de.mpa.io.parser.ec

Class XMLStripper

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.mpa.io.parser.ec.XMLStripper

  • public class XMLStripper
extends Object
    Utility class to parse an XML file and strip off unwanted nodes resulting in a reduced output file. Used to parse the xml of all EC numbers and create a reduced file.

    Used on IntEnz XML dumps

    Author:
    R. Heyer, A. Behne

    • Method Detail

      • strip

        public Source strip(File input,
                    String[] tags2strip)
             throws SAXException,
                    IOException,
                    ParserConfigurationException
        Parses the provided input XML file and removes the specified tags from it.
        Parameters:
        input - The input file.
        tags2strip - The array of tag names that are to be removed.
        Returns:
        the DOM input source of the reduced document.
        Throws:
        IOException - if any IO errors occur.
        SAXException - if any parse errors occur.
        ParserConfigurationException - if a DocumentBuilder cannot be created which satisfies the configuration requested.

      • write

        public void write(File output,
                  Source domSrc)
           throws TransformerFactoryConfigurationError,
                  TransformerException
        Writes the provided DOM input source to the specified file location.
        Parameters:
        output - The output file.
        domSrc - The DOM input source
        Throws:
        TransformerFactoryConfigurationError - when it is not possible to create a Transformer instance.
        TransformerException - if an unrecoverable error occurs during the course of the transformation.

      • main

        public static void main(String[] args)
                 throws Exception
        Runnable main method to dynamically pick a target XML file that is to be trimmed of the specified tags.
        Parameters:
        args - The array of tag names that are to be removed.
        Throws:
        Exception - if anything goes wrong.
